April is National Volunteer Month and we want to recognize our awesome volunteers. THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVICE!

Tina is the coordinator of our volunteers at NEO. She recruits, trains, and manages our team of volunteers throughout the school year.

"My favorite part of bringing volunteers to NEO is when they tell me they feel valuable by working with NEO students. The teachers have really enjoyed the volunteers as a second pair of hands helping out in their classrooms.

The impact the volunteers have on students is incredible. They are able to provide individual tutoring to students. Also, a few of our volunteers speak Spanish as a second language, which is helpful when working with some of our ESL students.

I am proud that our volunteers enjoy working at NEO, and although we are currently closed, they have expressed that they are willing to return in the fall when in-person classes begin again."

Evie began attending NEO's adult education classes after she moved to the U.S. from Greece. Even though Evie spent a lot of her time working, she wanted the chance to improve her English.

After enrolling in ESL classes, she set additional goals to earn her High School Equivalency (HSE) and become a licensed paraprofessional.

Within a year, Evie accomplished all of her goals and participated in NEO's annual graduation ceremony. She said her favorite part about classes at NEO was learning from her classmates.

"The best part was that everybody was from different parts of the world and the only way to communicate with one another was to talk in English. I had the opportunity to learn about other languages and cultures of the world."
